metadata.dc:author: Romero, R
Bonal, J
Fontseré, N
Bonet, J
metadata.dc:description: Hepatic tuberculosis is an exceptional form of presentation of extrapulmonary tuberculosis, but in the last years a greater incidence has been found in patients with HIV infection and/or consumptive diseases or immunosuppressive treatment. For this condition, the diagnosis of hepatic tuberculosis in other population groups represents a true clinical challenge because of the scarce specificity of both the clinical and biological manifestations. Despite deferral of the diagnosis, fast improvement is observed in the clinical symptomatology in most cases following initiation of tuberculostatic treatment.
metadata.dc:title: Tuberculosis hepática en paciente con nefropatía diabética. Una presentación infrecuente.
[Hepatic tuberculosis in a patient with diabetic nephropathy. An unusual clinical presentation].
metadata.dc:publisher: Nefrologia : publicacion oficial de la Sociedad Espanola Nefrologia
